title.raw: 卷一下 光武帝紀 Volume 1b: Annals of Emperor Guangwu

sentences.zh: 六年春正月丙辰，改舂陵郷為章陵縣。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, spring, first month, on Bingchen day, changed Chunling township to Zhangling county.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, on the Bingchen day of the first month of spring, Chunling township was redesignated as Zhangling county.

sentences.zh: 世世復傜役，比豐、沛，無有所豫。

translations.literal: Generation after generation exempt from forced labor service, compared to Feng, Pei, without any advance payments.
translations.idiomatic: Generation after generation was exempt from corvée labor, treated the same as Feng and Pei districts, with no advance levies.

sentences.zh: 〈高祖豐沛邑人，故代代復，今比之也。

translations.literal: (Gaozu was a native of Feng and Pei districts, therefore generation after generation exempt, now compared to it.
translations.idiomatic: (The Gaozu emperor was a native of Feng and Pei districts, so generation after generation was exempt from taxes; now this area is treated the same.

sentences.zh: 復音福。

translations.literal: Fu sounds like fu.
translations.idiomatic: Fu (exempt) sounds like fu (blessing).

sentences.zh: 辛酉，詔曰：「往歲水旱蝗蟲為灾，穀價騰躍，〈言踴貴也。

translations.literal: On Xinyou, edict said: 'In previous years floods, droughts, and locusts caused disasters, grain prices soared, (meaning prices jumped up.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinyou day, an edict declared: 'In recent years, floods, droughts, and locust swarms have brought disaster. Grain prices have skyrocketed. (Meaning prices have surged dramatically.

sentences.zh: 〉人用困乏。

translations.literal: ) people are impoverished.
translations.idiomatic: ) The people are destitute and suffering.

sentences.zh: 朕惟百姓無以自贍，惻然愍之。

translations.literal: I think that the common people have nothing to support themselves with, I am deeply sympathetic to them.
translations.idiomatic: I reflect that the common people have no means to support themselves. I am deeply moved with compassion for them.

sentences.zh: 其命郡國有穀者，給稟〈說文：「稟，賜穀也。」

translations.literal: Order that commanderies and kingdoms that have grain provide rations (Shuo Wen says: 'Bing means to grant grain.'
translations.idiomatic: Order that commanderies and kingdoms with surplus grain provide rations. (The Shuo Wen dictionary says: 'Bing means to grant grain.'

sentences.zh: 音筆錦反。

translations.literal: Sound is bi jin fan.
translations.idiomatic: Pronunciation: bǐ jǐn fǎn.

sentences.zh: 〉高年、鰥、寡、孤、獨及篤［］、無家屬貧不能自存者，如律。

translations.literal: ) to the elderly, widowers, widows, orphans, solitaries, and the seriously ill [ ], those without family who are poor and cannot support themselves, according to the law.
translations.idiomatic: ) to the elderly, widowers, widows, orphans, childless elderly, the seriously ill [ ], and those without family who are impoverished and cannot survive on their own, according to legal regulations.

sentences.zh: 〈大戴禮曰：「六十無妻曰鰥，五十無夫曰寡。」

translations.literal: (Da Dai Li says: 'Sixty without wife is called guan, fifty without husband is called gua.'
translations.idiomatic: (The Da Dai Li ritual text states: 'A man of sixty without a wife is called a widower; a woman of fifty without a husband is called a widow.'

sentences.zh: 禮記曰：「幼而無父曰孤，老而無子曰獨。」

translations.literal: Li Ji says: 'Young without father is called gu, old without son is called du.'
translations.idiomatic: The Book of Rites states: 'A child without a father is called an orphan; an elder without children is called solitary.'

sentences.zh: 爾雅曰：「篤，困也。」

translations.literal: Er Ya says: 'Du means distressed.'
translations.idiomatic: The Er Ya dictionary explains: 'Du means hardship or distress.'

sentences.zh: 蒼頡篇曰：「［］，病也。」

translations.literal: Cang Jie Pian says: '[ ], illness also.'
translations.idiomatic: The Cang Jie Pian dictionary states: '[ ], means illness.'

sentences.zh: 漢律今亡。

translations.literal: The Han laws are now lost.
translations.idiomatic: The Han legal code is now lost.

sentences.zh: 〉二千石勉加循撫，無令失職。」

translations.literal: ) To the prefects of 2000 bushels: diligently care for and comfort them, do not let them lose their positions.
translations.idiomatic: ) To the prefects of 2000 bushels: diligently oversee and provide for them; do not allow them to lose their offices.

sentences.zh: 〈職猶常也。

translations.literal: (Position is like normal.
translations.idiomatic: (Office is like regular/duty.

sentences.zh: 揚武將軍馬成等拔舒，獲李憲。

translations.literal: Yangwu General Ma Cheng and others captured Shu, captured Li Xian.
translations.idiomatic: Yangwu General Ma Cheng and his forces captured the city of Shu and took Li Xian prisoner.

sentences.zh: 二月，大司馬吳漢拔朐，獲董憲、龐萌，山東悉平。

translations.literal: In the second month, Grand Marshal Wu Han captured Qu, captured Dong Xian and Pang Meng; east of the mountains was completely pacified.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month, Grand Marshal Wu Han captured the city of Qu and took Dong Xian and Pang Meng prisoner. The region east of the mountains was completely pacified.

sentences.zh: 諸將還京師，置酒賞賜。

translations.literal: The various generals returned to the capital, set up wine and rewarded them.
translations.idiomatic: The generals returned to the capital where banquets were held to reward them.

sentences.zh: 三月，公孫述遣將任滿寇南郡。

translations.literal: In the third month, Gongsun Shu sent general Ren Man to attack Nanhun commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, Gongsun Shu dispatched his general Ren Man to invade Nanhun commandery.

sentences.zh: 〈今荊州也。

translations.literal: (Now Jing province.
translations.idiomatic: (This is now Jing province.

sentences.zh: 夏四月丙子，幸長安，始謁高廟，遂有事十一陵。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Bingzi day, visited Chang'an, first paid respects at the Gao temple, then performed rites at the eleven imperial tombs.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, on the Bingzi day of the fourth month, the emperor visited Chang'an. He first paid respects at the Gao ancestral temple, then performed ceremonies at the eleven imperial mausoleums.

sentences.zh: 〈有事謂祭也。

translations.literal: (Having affairs means sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: ('Having affairs' means performing sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 左傳曰：「有事於太廟。」

translations.literal: The Zuo Commentary says: 'Having affairs at the Grand Temple.'
translations.idiomatic: The Commentary of Zuo states: 'Performing affairs at the Grand Temple.'

sentences.zh: 高祖長陵，惠帝安陵，文帝霸陵，景帝陽陵，武帝茂陵，昭帝平陵，宣帝杜陵，元帝渭陵，成帝延陵，哀帝義陵，平帝康陵。

translations.literal: Gaozu Changling, Huidi Anling, Wendi Baling, Jingdi Yangling, Wudi Maoling, Zhaodi Pingling, Xuandi Duling, Yuandi Weiling, Chengdi Yanling, Aidi Yiling, Pingdi Kangling.
translations.idiomatic: These were: Gaozu's Chang Mausoleum, Huidi's An Mausoleum, Wendi's Ba Mausoleum, Jingdi's Yang Mausoleum, Wudi's Mao Mausoleum, Zhaodi's Ping Mausoleum, Xuandi's Du Mausoleum, Yuandi's Wei Mausoleum, Chengdi's Yan Mausoleum, Aidi's Yi Mausoleum, and Pingdi's Kang Mausoleum.

sentences.zh: 遣虎牙大將軍蓋延等七將軍從隴道伐公孫述。

translations.literal: Sent Tiger Tooth Grand General Gai Yan and six other generals to attack Gongsun Shu via the Long corridor road.
translations.idiomatic: Dispatched Tiger Tooth Grand General Gai Yan and six other generals to attack Gongsun Shu through the Longxi corridor.

sentences.zh: 五月己未，至自長安。

translations.literal: Fifth month, Jiwei day, arrived from Chang'an.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiwei day of the fifth month, arrived from Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 隗嚻反，蓋延等因與嚻戰於隴阺，諸將敗績。

translations.literal: Wei Xiao rebelled, Gai Yan and others thus fought with Xiao at Longse, the various generals suffered defeat.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Xiao rebelled. Gai Yan and his forces therefore fought with Wei Xiao at Longse, where the various generals suffered defeat.

sentences.zh: 辛丑，詔曰：「惟天水、隴西、安定、北地〈並郡名。

translations.literal: Xinchou day, edict said: 'As for Tianshui, Longxi, Anding, Beidi (all commandery names.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinchou day, an edict declared: 'As for Tianshui, Longxi, Anding, and Beidi commanderies (all are commandery names.

sentences.zh: 天水今秦州，安定今涇州，北地今寧州，隴西今渭州。

translations.literal: Tianshui is now Qin province, Anding is now Jing province, Beidi is now Ning province, Longxi is now Wei province.
translations.idiomatic: Tianshui is now Qin province, Anding is now Jing province, Beidi is now Ning province, Longxi is now Wei province.

sentences.zh: 〉吏人為隗嚻所詿誤者，〈說文曰：「詿亦誤也。」

translations.literal: ) Officials and people who were deceived and led astray by Wei Xiao, (Shuo Wen says: 'Gui is also mistake.'
translations.idiomatic: ) Officials and people who were deceived and misled by Wei Xiao. (The Shuo Wen dictionary says: 'Gui also means mistake.'

sentences.zh: 音古賣反。

translations.literal: Pronunciation: gu mai fan.
translations.idiomatic: Pronunciation: gǔ mài fǎn.

sentences.zh: 〉又三輔遭難赤眉，有犯法不道者，〈前書音義曰：「律：殺不辜一家三人為不道。」

translations.literal: ) Also, the Three Adjuncts suffered from the Red Eyebrows disaster, those who violated the law and were unprincipled, (Former Book pronunciation and meaning says: 'Law: killing the innocent three people from one family is unprincipled.'
translations.idiomatic: ) Also, the Three Adjuncts suffered disaster from the Red Eyebrows. Those who violated the law and were unprincipled. (The Former Book's pronunciation and meaning says: 'According to the law, killing three innocent people from one family constitutes unprincipled behavior.'

sentences.zh: 〉自殊死以下，皆赦除之。」

translations.literal: ) From capital punishment and below, all are pardoned and removed.
translations.idiomatic: ) From capital punishment downward, all are pardoned and exempted.

sentences.zh: 六月辛卯，詔曰：「夫張官置吏，所以為人也。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Xinmao day, edict said: 'Establishing offices and appointing officials is for the sake of the people.'
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinmao day of the sixth month, an edict declared: 'Establishing offices and appointing officials is done for the sake of the people.'

sentences.zh: 〈管子曰：「張官置吏，所以奉主之法。」

translations.literal: (Guanzi says: 'Establishing offices and appointing officials is to uphold the ruler's laws.'
translations.idiomatic: (The Guanzi says: 'Establishing offices and appointing officials is to uphold the ruler's laws.'

sentences.zh: 〉今百姓遭難，戶口耗少，而縣官吏職所置尚繁，其令司隷、州牧〈漢官儀曰：「司隷校尉部河南、河內、右扶風、左馮翊、京兆、河東、弘農七郡於河南洛陽，故謂東京為『司隷』。」

translations.literal: ) Now the common people have suffered disasters, household registrations are depleted and few, yet county offices and official positions established are still numerous. Order the Metropolitan Commandant and provincial governors (Han Guan Yi says: 'The Metropolitan Commandant oversees Henan, Henei, Right Fufeng, Left Fengyi, Jingzhao, Hedong, and Hongnong seven commanderies in Henan Luoyang, therefore the eastern capital is called 'Metropolitan Area'.'
translations.idiomatic: ) Now the common people have suffered disasters, and household registrations have dwindled. Yet county offices and official positions established remain numerous. Order the Metropolitan Commandant and provincial governors to assess their jurisdictions. (The Han Guan Yi says: 'The Metropolitan Commandant oversees the seven commanderies of Henan, Henei, Right Fufeng, Left Fengyi, Jingzhao, Hedong, and Hongnong, centered in Henan Luoyang. Therefore the eastern capital is called the 'Metropolitan Area'.'

sentences.zh: 〉各實所部，省減吏員。

translations.literal: ) Each should assess their jurisdiction, reduce and decrease official positions.
translations.idiomatic: ) Each should assess their jurisdiction and reduce the number of officials.

sentences.zh: 縣國不足置長吏可并合者，〈并音必政反。

translations.literal: Counties and kingdoms insufficient to establish chief officials that can be merged, (Bing pronunciation: bi zheng fan.
translations.idiomatic: Counties and kingdoms that are insufficient to establish chief officials may be merged. (Bing pronunciation: bì zhèng fǎn.

sentences.zh: 〉上大司徒、大司空二府。」

translations.literal: ) Report to the Grand Minister of Ceremonies and Grand Minister of Works two offices.
translations.idiomatic: ) Report to the offices of the Grand Minister of Ceremonies and Grand Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 於是條奏并省四百餘縣，吏職減損，十置其一。

translations.literal: Thereupon memorialized and merged and abolished four hundred and more counties, official positions reduced, ten established one.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon they memorialized to merge and abolish over four hundred counties, reducing official positions to one-tenth of what they had been.

sentences.zh: 代郡太守劉興擊盧芳將賈覽於高柳，戰歿。

translations.literal: Dai commandery governor Liu Xing attacked Lu Fang's general Jia Lan at Gao Liu, died in battle.
translations.idiomatic: Dai commandery governor Liu Xing attacked Lu Fang's general Jia Lan at Gao Liu and died in battle.

sentences.zh: 〈高柳，縣，屬代郡，故城在今雲州定襄縣。

translations.literal: (Gao Liu, county, belongs to Dai commandery, old city in today's Yun province Dingxiang county.
translations.idiomatic: (Gao Liu was a county belonging to Dai commandery; its old city is in today's Dingxiang county in Yun province.

sentences.zh: 初，樂浪人王調據郡不服。

translations.literal: Initially, Lelang person Wang Tiao occupied the commandery and did not submit.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Wang Tiao, a man from Lelang, occupied the commandery and refused to submit.

sentences.zh: 〈樂浪，郡，故朝鮮國也，在遼東。

translations.literal: (Lelang, commandery, formerly the kingdom of Joseon, located in Liaodong.
translations.idiomatic: (Lelang was a commandery, formerly the kingdom of Joseon, located in Liaodong.

sentences.zh: 〉秋，遣樂浪太守王遵擊之，郡吏殺調降。

translations.literal: ) Autumn, sent Lelang governor Wang Zun to attack him, commandery officials killed Tiao and surrendered.
translations.idiomatic: ) In autumn, Wang Zun was sent as Lelang governor to attack him. The commandery officials killed Tiao and surrendered.

sentences.zh: 遣前將軍李通率二將軍，與公孫述將戰於西城，破之。

translations.literal: Sent Former General Li Tong leading two generals, fought with Gongsun Shu's general at Xi Cheng, defeated him.
translations.idiomatic: Dispatched Former General Li Tong, leading two other generals, to fight Gongsun Shu's forces at Xi Cheng and defeat them.

sentences.zh: 〈西城，縣，屬漢中，今金州縣也。

translations.literal: (Xi Cheng, county, belongs to Hanzhong, today's Jin province county.
translations.idiomatic: (Xi Cheng was a county belonging to Hanzhong commandery; it is today's Jin province county.

sentences.zh: 夏，蝗。

translations.literal: Summer, locusts.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, there were locust swarms.

sentences.zh: 秋九月庚子，赦樂浪謀反大逆殊死已下。

translations.literal: Autumn ninth month Gengzi, pardoned Lelang plotting rebellion great treachery capital punishment and below.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengzi day of the ninth month in autumn, those in Lelang who plotted rebellion and committed great treachery were pardoned from capital punishment downward.

sentences.zh: 丙寅晦，日有食之。

translations.literal: Bingyin last day, the sun was eclipsed.
translations.idiomatic: On the last day of the month (Bingyin), there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: 冬十月丁丑，詔曰：「吾德薄不明，寇賊為害，彊弱相陵，元元失所。

translations.literal: Winter tenth month Dingchou, edict said: 'My virtue thin and unenlightened, bandits and rebels cause harm, strong bully weak, the common people lose their place.'
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingchou day of the tenth month in winter, an edict declared: 'My virtue is thin and unenlightened. Bandits and rebels cause harm. The strong bully the weak. The common people have lost their proper place.'

sentences.zh: 詩云：『日月告凶，不用其行。』

translations.literal: The Poetry says: 'Sun and moon announce ill fortune, do not use their courses.'
translations.idiomatic: As the Poetry says: 'The sun and moon announce ill fortune; do not follow their proper courses.'

sentences.zh: 〈詩小雅鄭玄注云：「告凶，告天下凶亡之徵也。

translations.literal: (Shi Xiao Ya Zheng Xuan commentary says: "Announce ill fortune announces to the world the omens of perishing."
translations.idiomatic: (Zheng Xuan's commentary on the Shi Xiao Ya says: "To announce ill fortune is to announce to the world the omens of ruin and extinction."

sentences.zh: 行，道度也。

translations.literal: Xing, path measure also.
translations.idiomatic: "Xing" means the proper measure of the path.

sentences.zh: 不用之者，謂相干犯。」

translations.literal: Not use them means mutually interfere violate.
translations.idiomatic: "Not use them" means they interfere with and violate each other.

sentences.zh: 〉永念厥咎，內疚於心。

translations.literal: ) Eternally contemplate their guilt, internally pained in heart.
translations.idiomatic: ) I eternally contemplate their guilt; internally I am pained in my heart.

sentences.zh: 〈疚，病也。

translations.literal: (Jiu, illness also.
translations.idiomatic: ("Jiu" means illness/pain.

sentences.zh: 詩曰：「憂心孔疚。」

translations.literal: Shi says: "Worried heart greatly pained."
translations.idiomatic: As the Shi says: "The worried heart is greatly pained."

sentences.zh: 〉其勑公卿舉賢良、方正各一人；

translations.literal: ) Order the ministers to recommend worthy and good, upright and proper each one person;
translations.idiomatic: ) Order the ministers to recommend one person each who is worthy and good, upright and proper;

sentences.zh: 〈武帝建元元年，始詔舉賢良方正、直言極諫之士也。

translations.literal: (Wu Emperor Jian Yuan first year, began edict to recommend worthy good upright proper, straightforward speech extreme remonstrance gentlemen also.
translations.idiomatic: (In the first year of Emperor Wu's Jian Yuan reign, he began issuing edicts to recommend gentlemen who were worthy and good, upright and proper, who spoke straightforwardly and remonstrated extremely.

sentences.zh: 〉百僚並上封事，無有隱諱；

translations.literal: ) All officials together submit sealed memorials, without any concealment;
translations.idiomatic: ) All officials shall jointly submit sealed memorials without any concealment;

sentences.zh: 〈宣帝始令羣臣得奏封事，以知下情。

translations.literal: (Xuan Emperor began ordering the assembled ministers to be able submit sealed memorials, in order to know lower sentiments.
translations.idiomatic: (Emperor Xuan began allowing the assembled ministers to submit sealed memorials in order to understand the sentiments of those below.

sentences.zh: 〉有司修職，務遵法度。」

translations.literal: ) The various offices repair their duties, earnestly comply with laws and regulations.
translations.idiomatic: ) The various offices shall repair their duties and earnestly comply with laws and regulations.

sentences.zh: 十一月丁卯，詔王莽時吏人沒入為奴婢不應舊法者，皆免為庶人。

translations.literal: Eleventh month Dingmao, edict said: "Wang Mang time officials and people confiscated to become slave and maidservant not conforming to old laws, all exempt to become commoners."
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingmao day of the eleventh month, an edict declared: "Officials and people who were confiscated to become slaves and maidservants during Wang Mang's time, not conforming to the old laws, shall all be exempted and become commoners."

sentences.zh: 十二月壬辰，大司空宋弘免。

translations.literal: Twelfth month Renchen, Grand Minister of Works Song Hong dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renchen day of the twelfth month, Grand Minister of Works Song Hong was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 癸巳，詔曰：「頃者師旅未解，用度不足，故行十一之稅。

translations.literal: Guiwei, edict said: "Recently armies not disbanded, expenditures insufficient, therefore implement one tenth tax.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guiwei day, an edict declared: "Recently the armies have not been disbanded and expenditures are insufficient, therefore we implement a tax of one-tenth."

sentences.zh: 〈謂十分而稅其一也。

translations.literal: (Meaning take one part from ten parts as tax also.
translations.idiomatic: (Meaning to take one part from ten parts as the tax.

sentences.zh: 孟子曰：「夏五十而貢，殷七十而助，周百畒而徹，其實皆什一也。」

translations.literal: Mencius said: "Xia fifty and tribute, Yin seventy and assistance, Zhou hundred mu and interchange, their substance all ten one also."
translations.idiomatic: Mencius said: "The Xia levied tribute on fifty-acre plots, the Yin provided assistance on seventy-acre plots, the Zhou alternated on hundred-acre plots—their substance was all one-tenth."

sentences.zh: 〉今軍士屯田，糧儲差積。

translations.literal: ) Now military officers farm fields, grain stores somewhat accumulated.
translations.idiomatic: ) Now the military officers cultivate fields, and grain stores have accumulated somewhat.

sentences.zh: 〈武帝初通西域，始置校尉屯田。

translations.literal: (Wu Emperor initially opened the Western Regions, began establishing commandants to farm fields.
translations.idiomatic: (Emperor Wu initially opened relations with the Western Regions and began establishing commandants to cultivate fields.

sentences.zh: 〉其令郡國收見田租三十稅一，如舊制。」

translations.literal: ) Order the commanderies and kingdoms to collect visible field rent thirty tax one, like old system.
translations.idiomatic: ) Order the commanderies and kingdoms to collect field rent at a rate of one-thirtieth, according to the old system.

sentences.zh: 〈景帝二年，令人田租三十而稅一，今依景帝，故云「舊制」。

translations.literal: (Jing Emperor second year, caused people field rent thirty and tax one, now follow Jing Emperor, therefore say "old system".
translations.idiomatic: (In the second year of Emperor Jing's reign, the field rent was set at thirty parts with one part tax; now following Emperor Jing, therefore called the "old system".

sentences.zh: 隗嚻遣將行巡寇扶風，〈行，姓；

translations.literal: Wei Xiao sent general Xing Xun invade Fufeng, (Xing, surname;
translations.idiomatic: Wei Xiao sent his general Xing Xun to invade Fufeng. (Xing is the surname;

sentences.zh: 巡，名。

translations.literal: Xun, name.
translations.idiomatic: Xun is the given name.

sentences.zh: 漢有行祐，為趙相，見風俗通。

translations.literal: Han has Xing You, served as chancellor of Zhao, see Fengsu Tong.
translations.idiomatic: The Han dynasty had a Xing You who served as chancellor of Zhao; see the Fengsu Tong.

sentences.zh: 〉征西大將軍馮異拒破之。

translations.literal: ) Western Expedition Grand General Feng Yi resisted and defeated him.
translations.idiomatic: ) Western Expedition Grand General Feng Yi resisted and defeated them.

sentences.zh: 是歲，初罷郡國都尉官。

translations.literal: This year, initially abolished commandery and kingdom commandants offices.
translations.idiomatic: This year, the offices of commandery and kingdom commandants were initially abolished.

sentences.zh: 始遣列侯就國。

translations.literal: Began sending marquises to their fiefs.
translations.idiomatic: Began dispatching the marquises to their feudal territories.

sentences.zh: 匈奴遣使來獻，使中郎將報命。

translations.literal: Xiongnu sent envoys to offer tribute, sent Colonel to report the command.
translations.idiomatic: The Xiongnu sent envoys to offer tribute; sent a Colonel to convey the imperial response.

sentences.zh: 〈漢官儀曰：「使匈奴中郎將，擁節，秩比二千石。」

translations.literal: (Han Guan Yi says: "Make Xiongnu Colonel, holds tally, rank compares to two thousand bushels."
translations.idiomatic: (The Han Guan Yi says: "The Colonel for Xiongnu Affairs holds a tally and has a rank equivalent to two thousand bushels."

sentences.zh: 匈奴傳云：「令中郎將韓統報命，賂遺金幣。」

translations.literal: Xiongnu Biography says: "Ordered Colonel Han Tong report the command, bestowed gold coins."
translations.idiomatic: The Xiongnu Biography states: "Ordered Colonel Han Tong to convey the command and bestowed gold coins as gifts."

translations.literal: Seventh year spring first month Bing Shen, decree capital officials, three metropolitan areas, commanderies, kingdoms release prisoners, not guilty of capital crimes, all do not investigate their crimes.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, spring, first month, day Bing Shen, an imperial decree ordered that officials in the capital, the Three Metropolitan Areas, the commanderies, and the kingdoms release prisoners not guilty of capital crimes, and not investigate their offenses.

sentences.zh: 見徒免為庶民。

translations.literal: Seen convicts released as common people.
translations.idiomatic: Convicts who had been seen [by the emperor] were released to become common people.

sentences.zh: 耐罪亡命，吏以文除之。

translations.literal: Endure crime fugitives, officials with documents remove them.
translations.idiomatic: Fugitives who had endured punishment were officially removed from the records with documents.

sentences.zh: 〈耐，輕刑之名。

translations.literal: (Endure, light punishment name.
translations.idiomatic: (To endure is the name of a light punishment.

sentences.zh: 前書音義曰：「一歲刑為罰作，二歲刑已上為耐。」

translations.literal: Former Book Sound Meaning says: "One year punishment is penal labor, two year punishment and above is endure."
translations.idiomatic: The Former Book's Sound and Meaning says: "One year of punishment is penal labor; two years of punishment and above is called enduring."

sentences.zh: 耐音乃代反。

translations.literal: Endure sound Nai Dai reverse.
translations.idiomatic: Endure is pronounced Nai Dai, going against the norm.

sentences.zh: 亡命謂犯耐罪而背名逃者。

translations.idiomatic: Fugitives are those who committed endure crimes and fled while changing their names.

translations.literal: Cause officials to make documents, record their names and remove their crimes, fear they would flee and not return, thus losing name registers.
translations.idiomatic: Order officials to create documents recording their names and removing their crimes, fearing that they would flee and not return, thus losing the name registers.

sentences.zh: 〉法令不能禁，禮義不能止，倉卒乃知其咎。

translations.literal: ) Laws cannot prohibit, rites cannot stop, sudden then know their fault.
translations.idiomatic: ) Laws cannot prohibit it, ritual propriety cannot stop it, and only in times of sudden crisis do they realize their fault.

sentences.zh: 〈倉卒謂喪亂也。

translations.literal: (Sudden means mourning chaos also.
translations.idiomatic: (Sudden refers to mourning and chaos.

sentences.zh: 諸厚葬者皆被發掘，故乃知其咎。

translations.literal: Those who thick bury all suffer excavation, therefore then know their fault.
translations.idiomatic: Those who practiced lavish burials all suffered grave robberies, and therefore only then realized their fault.

sentences.zh: 咎，惡也。

translations.literal: Fault, evil also.
translations.idiomatic: Fault means evil.

sentences.zh: 〉其布告天下，令知忠臣、孝子、慈兄、悌弟薄葬送終之義。」

translations.literal: ) Order proclaim to all under heaven, cause know loyal ministers, filial sons, kind elder brothers, respectful younger brothers thin burial send to end virtue."
translations.idiomatic: ) Order that this be proclaimed throughout the empire, so that people know the virtue of loyal ministers, filial sons, kind elder brothers, and respectful younger brothers in practicing modest burials and proper funerals."

sentences.zh: 二月辛巳，罷護漕都尉官。

translations.literal: Second month Xin Si, abolished protect grain transport commandants office.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xin Si day of the second month, the office of commandants for protecting grain transport was abolished.

translations.idiomatic: Army temporary officials refers to officials provisionally placed within the army.

translations.idiomatic: ) Cause them to return to civilian ranks."

sentences.zh: 公孫述立隗嚻為朔寧王。

translations.literal: Gongsun Shu established Wei Xiao as Shuo Ning king.
translations.idiomatic: Gongsun Shu established Wei Xiao as King of Shuo Ning.

sentences.zh: 癸亥晦，日有食之，避正殿，寑兵，不聽事五日。

translations.literal: Gui Hai last day, sun had eclipse, avoid main hall, rest troops, not listen to affairs five days.
translations.idiomatic: On the last day of the month (Gui Hai), there was a solar eclipse. The emperor avoided the main hall, rested the troops, and did not attend to affairs for five days.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：「吾德薄致災，讁見日月，〈讁，責也。

translations.literal: Decree says: "My virtue thin causes disaster, blame appears sun moon, (Blame, blame also.
translations.idiomatic: An imperial decree stated: "My virtue is thin and has caused this disaster; blame appears in the sun and moon. (Blame means to blame.

sentences.zh: 音直革反。

translations.literal: Sound Zhi Ge reverse.
translations.idiomatic: It is pronounced Zhi Ge, going against the norm.

sentences.zh: 左傳曰：「人君為政不用善，自取讁於日月之災也。」

translations.literal: Zuo Commentary says: "Person ruler for government not use good, self take blame from sun moon disaster also."
translations.idiomatic: The Commentary of Zuo says: "When a ruler governs without using the good, he himself takes blame from the disasters of sun and moon."

sentences.zh: 〉戰慄恐懼，夫何言哉！

translations.literal: ) War tremble fear dread, what words indeed!
translations.idiomatic: ) I tremble in fear and dread—what words can I say!

sentences.zh: 今方念愆，庶消厥咎。

translations.literal: Now just think of faults, hope dispel their fault.
translations.idiomatic: Now I am just reflecting on my faults, hoping to dispel this blame.

sentences.zh: 其令有司各修職任，奉遵法度，惠茲元元。

translations.literal: Order officials each repair duty responsibility, respectfully follow laws degrees, favor this primordial people.
translations.idiomatic: Order all officials to each repair their duties and responsibilities, respectfully follow the laws and regulations, and show favor to these primordial people.

sentences.zh: 百僚各上封事，無有所諱。

translations.literal: All officials each present sealed memorials, nothing concealed.
translations.idiomatic: All officials shall each present sealed memorials, concealing nothing.

translations.idiomatic: Those who submit memorials must not refer to the sage."

translations.idiomatic: On the Ren Wu day of the fourth month of summer, an imperial decree stated: "Recently yin and yang have been wrongly confused, with the sun and moon suffering eclipses.

sentences.zh: 百姓有過，在予一人，大赦天下。

translations.literal: Common people have transgressions, in me one person, great pardon all under heaven.
translations.idiomatic: If the common people have transgressions, they lie with me alone—a general amnesty for all under heaven.

sentences.zh: 公、卿、司隷、州牧舉賢良、方正各一人，遣詣公車，朕將覽試焉。」

translations.literal: Dukes, ministers, superintendent of the capital, provincial governors recommend worthy good, square correct each one person, send to public carriage, I will examine test them."
translations.idiomatic: The dukes, ministers, Superintendent of the Capital, and provincial governors shall each recommend one worthy and good, square and correct person, and send them to the public carriage gate where I will examine and test them."

sentences.zh: 〈公車，門名。

translations.literal: (Public carriage, gate name.
translations.idiomatic: (Public carriage is the name of a gate.

sentences.zh: 公車所在，因以名焉。

translations.literal: Public carriage location, therefore name it thus.
translations.idiomatic: Where the public carriage is located, therefore it is named thus.

sentences.zh: 漢官儀曰：「公車掌殿司馬門，天下上事及徵召皆緫領之。」

translations.literal: Han Guan Yi says: "Public carriage manages palace horse gate, all under heaven submit affairs and summons all led by it."
translations.idiomatic: The Han Guan Yi says: "The public carriage manages the palace horse gate; all affairs submitted from under heaven and all summons are led by it."

sentences.zh: 五月戊戌，前將軍李通為大司空。

translations.literal: Fifth month Wu Xu, former general Li Tong became grand minister of works.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wu Xu day of the fifth month, former general Li Tong became Grand Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 甲寅，詔吏人遭饑亂及為青、徐賊所略為奴婢下妻，欲去留者，恣聽之。

translations.literal: Jia Yin, decree officials people suffer famine chaos and by Qing, Xu bandits seized as slaves maidservants under wives, desire go stay ones, freely listen to them.
translations.idiomatic: On Jia Yin, an imperial decree for officials and people who suffered famine and chaos and were seized by Qing and Xu bandits to become slaves, maidservants, or secondary wives: those who wish to go or stay shall be freely allowed to do so.

translations.literal: (Du Yu annotation Zuo Commentary says: "Not by way take as seize."
translations.idiomatic: (Du Yu's annotation on the Commentary of Zuo says: "To seize means to take without following proper ways."

translations.literal: ) Dare restrain not return, with sell person law handle affairs.
translations.idiomatic: ) Those who dare to restrain them and not let them return shall be handled according to the law for selling persons.

translations.literal: (Speak of following sell person matters to determine their crime.
translations.idiomatic: (This means to determine their crime following the matters of selling persons.

sentences.zh: 是夏，連雨水。

translations.literal: This summer, continuous rain water.
translations.idiomatic: This summer there was continuous rain.

translations.literal: Han loyal general Wang Chang became roaming field grand general.
translations.idiomatic: Han loyal general Wang Chang became Grand General of Roaming Field.

translations.literal: Eighth month Ding Hai, enfeoff former Hejian king Shao as Hejian king.
translations.idiomatic: On the Ding Hai day of the eighth month, the former King Shao of Hejian was enfeoffed as King of Hejian.

translations.idiomatic: Wei Xiao invaded Anding. Western Expedition Grand General Feng Yi and Invasion Subduing General Ji Zun struck and repulsed him.

sentences.zh: 冬，盧芳所置朔方太守田颯、〈音立。

translations.idiomatic: In winter, Tian Sa, the governor of Shuofang placed by Lu Fang, (pronounced Li.

translations.literal: ) Yunzhong governor Qiao Hu each lead commandery surrender.

translations.literal: (Former Book Sound Meaning says: "Changshui, place name, barbarian cavalry stationed.
translations.idiomatic: (The Former Book's Sound and Meaning says: "Changshui is a place name where barbarian cavalry was stationed.

translations.literal: Shesheng means skilled archers also, night middle hear sound then shoot it, therefore name it thus."
translations.idiomatic: Shesheng refers to skilled archers who, when they heard sounds in the night, would shoot at them—hence the name."

translations.literal: Two commandants all Wu Emperor established, now reduce them.
translations.idiomatic: Both commandants were established by Emperor Wu; now they are being abolished.

translations.literal: ) Kill Wei Xiao guard general and occupy his city.
translations.idiomatic: ) He killed Wei Xiao's defending general and occupied the city.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，司隷校尉傅抗下獄死。

translations.literal: Summer fourth month, superintendent of capital commandants Fu Kang imprisoned die.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, Superintendent of the Capital Commandants Fu Kang was imprisoned and died.

translations.literal: Wei Xiao attack Lai Xi, cannot conquer.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Xiao attacked Lai Xi but could not conquer him.

translations.idiomatic: In the intercalary month, the emperor personally campaigned against Wei Xiao. Hexi governor Dou Rong led the governors of five commanderies to meet the imperial carriage at Gaoping.

translations.literal: (Five commanderies mean Longxi, Jincheng, Tianshui, Jiuquan, Zhangye.
translations.idiomatic: (The five commanderies are Longxi, Jincheng, Tianshui, Jiuquan, and Zhangye.

translations.idiomatic: Gaoping is a county name belonging to Anding commandery; later changed to Pinggao, now Yuan province county.

translations.idiomatic: ) They did not surrender, so Tiger Tooth Grand General Gai Yan and Prestige Establishing Grand General Geng Yin were commanded to attack it.

translations.idiomatic: Bandit thieves from Yingchuan invaded and submerged the subordinate counties. The guarding troops of the Hedong governor also rebelled, disturbing the capital.

sentences.zh: 秋，大水。

translations.literal: Autumn, great water.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, there was great flooding.

sentences.zh: 八月，帝自上邽晨夜東馳。

translations.literal: Eighth month, emperor from Shanggui morning night east gallop.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, the emperor galloped east from Shanggui, morning and night.

translations.idiomatic: On Geng Shen, the emperor personally campaigned against the Yingchuan bandit thieves; they all surrendered.

translations.idiomatic: Marquis of Anqiu Zhang Bu rebelled and returned to Langye. (Anqiu is a county belonging to Beihai commandery; now Mi province county, has Quqiu pavilion.

translations.idiomatic: ) Langye governor Chen Jun attacked and captured him.

translations.idiomatic: On Wu Yin, he arrived back from Yingchuan.

translations.literal: Eleventh month Yi Chou, arrive from Huai.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yi Chou day of the eleventh month, he arrived back from Huai.

translations.idiomatic: Gongsun Shu sent troops to rescue Wei Xiao. Wu Han, Gai Yan, and others returned their armies to Chang'an.

translations.idiomatic: Tianshui and Longxi again rebelled and returned to Wei Xiao.

translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, the king of Gaogouli sent envoys to offer tribute.

translations.idiomatic: This year there was great flooding.

translations.literal: (Zuo Commentary says: "Plain emerge water is great water."
translations.idiomatic: (The Commentary of Zuo says: "When water emerges on the plains, it is called great flooding."

translations.idiomatic: These two mountains are Chu's western barrier."
